info.name: fiserv.dev
info.description:
For use with the Fiserv EMEA Developer Platform APIs (https://fiserv.dev).

It contains all currently available Experience APIs with some example requests for each endpoint.

Also see the attached environment (fiserv.dev) for the required variables (such as URL and Api Key).

item.description:
Our payments solutions enable you to integrate them into a seamless customer experience, and enable you to accept your customers' preferred payment methods.

If you want to build your own UI and manage payments within your checkout flow natively within your own site or application, use our RESTful APIs. For this, you'll need to have the relevant PCI Compliance capabilities to process raw card data, but you can own the end to end customer experience.

item.name: SCA Exemptions - Live

response.name: LOV - NO SCA - Low value transaction
REC - NO SCA - Recurring transaction
MIT - NO SCA - Merchant initiated
EEA - SCA OPTIONAL - One leg out
TRA - NO SCA - Transaction risk analysis
NUL - SCA Required
NUL - SCA Strict
NUL - SCA Mandated
NUL - Decline to merchant

item.description:
Our SCA Exemptions API provides the ability to assess whether an exemption can be applied to a ecommerce transaction before completing checkout. The following exemptions are covered by the API:

*   Low value (Article 16) - LOV
*   Recurring transaction (Article 14) - REC
*   Merchant initiated transactions - MIT
*   Transaction Risk Analysis (Article 18) - TRA
*   One leg out (issuer/acquirer outside EEA) - EEA

item.name: Statements - Live
item.description: The Statements API allows the retrieval of financial statements for merchants, including some metadata as well as the generated pdf copy of the statement.

item.name: Transactional Data - Live
item.description: Transactional data refers to a set of data APIs that allow you to retrieve transactional payment data, such as **authorisations**, cleared **transactions,** and **funding** records. It provides the tools required for you to understand payment volume, reconcile payments, and diagnose areas of potential lost revenue such as card declines.

item.name: Documents - Live
item.description: The Documents API is primarily for use alongside the Merchant Boarding API as a means to provide identification, contractual and financial evidences during the boarding process. Once documents have been uploaded they are used by the boarding systems to complete any KYC or KYB checks as necessary. However, other forms of documents can be upload and retrieved outside of this primary purpose as required.

item.description:
Our Offers Management System is a prerequisite to boarding a merchant. There are two types of offers:

Acquiring offers: this type of offer is in relation to how transactions are processed including attributes like pricing
Equipment offers: this type of offer is in relation to equipment and services to accept payments e.g. a card terminal that accepts Visa and Mastercard
Offers are pre-configured in the Offers Management System UI. Our API allows you to retrieve these offers so they can be used with our merchant boarding API.

item.description: Our Terminals API currently provides the ability to retrieve terminal data and to attach and detach a terminal from another device, however there are plans for this to be expanded to enable comprehensive control over Terminals via API.
Our API Products aimed just at omnichannel and AQaaS clients, such as boarding or point of sale.
